text:
Good Morning Everyone, quick question: Would it be possible to implemnet bootstrap 5 in order to create custom templates?
Thank you very much

Really? I have read some articles that not possible as they are not having the same jquery version. Also do you think it would be possible to exclude layout.css?

Thank you

If you use <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/building-blocks/templates/html-hubl-templates|html+HubL templates> we do not force loading of layout.css.

Additionally you choose what jQuery version you want, you can even go without jQuery all together.
Ok Great :slightly_smiling_face: I ll check and come back. Thank you all :slightly_smiling_face:
In the drag n drop templates is it possible to use it?
as i try to recreate a template but giving the ability to creators to modify blocks locations etc

You should use html+HubL templates instead with `dnd_area`. It provides a drastically better experience for content creators to modify, move, add/remove modules to a page.

The old <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/building-blocks/templates/drag-and-drop-templates|design manager drag and drop templates> force loading the layout.css file.

So on those old templates if you wanted to use different CSS you would have to override that `layout.css` file.

html+HubL templates do not automatically load the layout.css file, even if they have `dnd_area`
Reading these posts now .. so good. Great Job, Andrey
